localised_text.tooltip_text: Opens up the logs/terrain.html file so you can see more details about the current selected map. Updated once the radar preview is finished updating (you can just refresh the browser when the the radar generation stops to see details of newly selected map)
Saves the image of the radar to appdata logs folder with name radar_preview
Change the tower level||The attacking team is given the displayed funds based on the selected tower level.
Controls the number of entities per unit
The amount available to spend on your army.

label_context_name.comment: Fill in context object and function to match objects dealing with so can display object. Also feel free to add any other children such as icons want to display for each entry, etc

label_large_armies.componentleveltooltip: Regular armies are limited to a maximum of 20 units, whereas large armies have are limited to a maximum of 40 units.||This option is unavailable when more than 4 armies are involved in the battle.

label_map_author.comment: Fill in context object and function to match objects dealing with so can display object. Also feel free to add any other children such as icons want to display for each entry, etc

label_map_name.comment: Fill in context object and function to match objects dealing with so can display object. Also feel free to add any other children such as icons want to display for each entry, etc

label_multi_lords.componentleveltooltip: When checked, multiple Lords can be added to the army instead of just one. Only the first Lord in the list will count as the army commander in battle.

label_realism_mode.componentleveltooltip: When checked, battles must be fought without the radar map or contextual tooltips. Orders may not be issued whilst the battle is paused and the game speed may not be slowed.||The camera will be restricted to within 200 meters of any unit, and any enemy units more than 600 meters away will be hidden from sight.
When checked, if using default funds, each player will have less funds the more members there are in a team.

label_storm_of_magic.componentleveltooltip: The battles takes place within a Storm of Magic. The Winds of Magic are infinite in these battles, so casting spells will change the ascendant Wind, each with a global effect and a different cataclysm spell.

label_unit_caps.componentleveltooltip: Toggle multiplayer unit caps. The unit cap limits the total number of units associated with a single unit type in an army. Some units contribute towards several unit caps. If capacity is reached for any of the associated unit caps, the unit cannot be recruited.||Unit caps are always applied to ranked battles.

selected_context_display.comment: Just fill in the context object and context function to display what information you want about the selected context from the dropdown. Feel free to also add any other children you want like icons, etc that you want to display related to the selected context!

template_dropdown_entry.comment: Fill in context object type with what type need to store for diplay purposes and for passing along. Also feel free to change ContextCommandLeftClick to an initialiser or whatever else you want to handle when selecting an entry. Also feel free to add any other children such as icons want to display for each entry, etc
